message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.MM 

This paper deals with domain adaptation for per-pixel prediction tasks, which is a common problem in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also introduces a novel freeze approach to maintain spatial and contextual relationships between tasks, which involves training a neural network, suggesting that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of anchor tasks, which are less expensive to acquire and shared between synthetic and real datasets, indicating that it could also fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.RO (Robotics). Finally, the paper evaluates its methods on surface normal estimation in indoor scenes and faces, which suggests that it could also be classified under cs.MM (Multimedia).
